S.FORM: tupa’un nak ngan tu Tiang.
S.TRANSL: 我的名字是Tiang。
My name is Tiang.

S.FORM: tupa’un cia tama nak ngan tu Biung.
S.TRANSL: 我爸爸的名字是Biung。
My dad’s name is Biung.

S.FORM: tupa’un cia tina nak ngan tu Aping.
S.TRANSL: 我媽媽的名字是Aping。
My mother’s name is Aping.

S.FORM: mac’an nak haip pa qamisan.
S.TRANSL: 我今年10歲。
I am 10 years old.

S.FORM: heza nak tatinin masitoqas, tupa’un tu Lukus, mac’an qan tas’a ka qamisan cia haip
S.TRANSL: 我有一個哥哥，他叫Lukus，他今年11歲。
I have a brother, his name is Lukus, he is 11 years old.

S.FORM: maszang nam ma kaku’ dangian masipul.
S.TRANSL: 我們在同一間學校讀書。
We study in the same school.

S.FORM: asa amin cam tusauc.
S.TRANSL: 我們都喜歡唱歌。
Both my brother and I like to sing.

S.FORM: madu cak taldanav maca pal’u’un na, muskun cam tastulumaq taldanav.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡游泳，如果放假的時候，我們全家會一起去游泳。
I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

S.FORM: asa cak pasaqal kaviaz, maqtu cam muskun tusauc taldanav.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡認識朋友，我們可以一起唱歌和游泳。
I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.

S.FORM: uva’az cak Bunun.
S.TRANSL: 我是布農族的小孩。
I am an Bunun child.

S.FORM: han nam tamazu’an na lumaq.
S.TRANSL: 我們家住在地利。
Our family lives in tamazu’an.

S.FORM: hahima cam tastulumaq.
S.TRANSL: 我們一家共有五個人。
There are five people in our family.

S.FORM: heza cam tatau tec’an.
S.TRANSL: 我們有三個兄弟姊妹。
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

S.FORM: muskun cam tastulumaq miqumic.
S.TRANSL: 我們一家人生活在一起。
I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

S.FORM: madaqvas sa tama nak, kisacu’ a tama nak.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很高，我的爸爸是警察。
My father is tall and he is a policeman.

S.FORM: makuis sa tina nak, ising nga tina nak.
S.TRANSL: 我的媽媽很瘦，我的媽媽是醫生。
My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

S.FORM: malasbunun na tama nam han lumaq bazbaz zami.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸在家會和我們說族語。
My father speaks the Bunun language with us at home.

S.FORM: munhan cam acang maca pal’u’un.
S.TRANSL: 我們暑假都會回部落。
We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

S.FORM: muskun cak masitoqas nak madamu opop.
S.TRANSL: 我和兄姊會一起抓青蛙。
My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.

S.FORM: madedaz cak inak tastulumaq.
S.TRANSL: 我很喜歡我的家人。
I like our family very much.

S.FORM: dusa’ cak tina nak munata haip paqaqenan.
S.TRANSL: 今天我和媽媽兩個人出去玩。
I went out with my mother today.

S.FORM: masanglav va diqanin, nitu makazhav nitu maklang, makazhav va luvluv.
S.TRANSL: 白天的天空很藍，天氣不冷也不熱，風很涼爽。
The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

S.FORM: ihan cam nastu ismut mama’un pang, sanvali’an na hubung siklangan.
S.TRANSL: 我們在草地上吃著麵包，陽光灑在身上，非常溫暖。
We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

S.FORM: minaun tongquvali, matudangqac ca diqanin.
S.TRANSL: 下午，天空變紅了。
In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

S.FORM: macingav cak tina tu “makuacuna madangqac ca diqanin.”
S.TRANSL: 我問媽媽，為甚麼天空是紅色的。
I asked my mother why the sky is red.

S.FORM: tupa ka tina tu “nalauqa luvluvan.”
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說，可能是颱風要來了。
Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

S.FORM: sanavan uka luhum han diqanin, minsumain na bintoqan.
S.TRANSL: 晚上天上沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

S.FORM: namudanin cam mulumaq.
S.TRANSL: 我們也要回家了。
We were going home too.

S.FORM: ihan mulumaq tu dan, tupaun zaku ka bintoqan tu.
S.TRANSL: 在回家的路上，我跟星星許願，
On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,

S.FORM: maqtu’ang uka’ a luvluv minsuma, opa asang cak moqnang munata paqaqenan.
S.TRANSL: 希望颱風不要來，因為，我還想再出去玩。
I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

S.FORM: han nak ka kaku’ ngalan lumaq nam, daqdaqqanin cak tan’anak munhan kaku’, tan’anak amin mulumaq.
S.TRANSL: 我的學校在我們家旁邊，我天天走路去學校，也走路回家。
My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

S.FORM: ni nam ma kaku’ madaing, nitu madia’ a pantu’, amin cam pasaqal.
S.TRANSL: 我們學校不大，沒有很多學生，大家互相認識。
Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

S.FORM: amin na uvava’az si’anpuk han deseq, muskun pismali’, muskun pababazbaz.
S.TRANSL: 所有小朋友會聚在操場，一起玩球、一起聊天。
All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

S.FORM: muskun amin na sinsi’ zami paqaqenan, maszang nga kaku’ tastulumaq.
S.TRANSL: 老師們也會和我們一起玩，學校像個大家庭。
The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

S.FORM: daqdaqqanin cam ma’asik, asatu piningzavun na dangi’an ma’asik.
S.TRANSL: 我們每天都要打掃，大家要把教室打掃乾淨。
We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

S.FORM: heza maqesqes tongkul, heza ma’asik.
S.TRANSL: 有些人去擦窗戶，有些人去掃地。
Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

S.FORM: asikun amin zami ka caikuciaku ki kaku’, paqusil cam kukuza, daqdaqqanin na kaku’ maningzav.
S.TRANSL: 我們還會打掃學校的各個角落，大家分工合作，學校每天都很乾淨。
We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

S.FORM: munhan cak takna acang tantungu han qudasnanaz.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我去部落拜訪爺爺。
Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

S.FORM: talmadin cam nitu pasadu, miliskin cak cia.
S.TRANSL: 我們很久沒有見面了，我很想念他。
We haven’t seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

S.FORM: sadu ka qudasnanaz zaku, usun cak pa’ka’un salitung, paqu’ ucia’.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺一看到我，就請我吃木瓜，請我喝茶。
As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat papaya and drink tea.

S.FORM: madavuc ca sincuaz qudasnanaz salitung, macial ko’nun.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺種的木瓜很甜，真的很好吃。
The papaya grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

S.FORM: asa amin cak ucia’ i qudasnanaz, macial amin qu’dan.
S.TRANSL: 我也喜歡爺爺的茶，也很好喝。
I also like grandpa’s tea, it’s tasted good too.

S.FORM: matu tongquvali ka, muskun cak qudasno’az pit’ia petutongquvali.
S.TRANSL: 中午的時候，我和奶奶一起煮午餐。
At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

S.FORM: mahanat ta qudasno’az mahancum tu petutongquvali, heza iskan, tulkuk, bahat, hezang qazuqazu’.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶煮了很豐盛的午餐，有魚、有雞、有南瓜、還有蝸牛。
Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

S.FORM: mina’unin tongquvali, munhan cam pisanglavan matinguc sanglav.
S.TRANSL: 吃完午餐後，我們去菜園摘菜。
After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

S.FORM: siza’ a qudasno’az madia hutan, tai cin tilkum, napa’adas zaku mulumaq.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶拿了很多地瓜、芋頭和蕗蕎給我，要我帶回家。
Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

S.FORM: namudanin cak, tupaun zaku nai tu namoqnang cak mun’iti sadu mu’u.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開了，我對他們說下次再來看你們。
I said goodbye to them and said I’d see them next time.

S.FORM: adasun cam haip sinsi’ munhan sadu’an tesmumut, tidelaz cam han hilav mabaliv kipu’.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師帶我們去動物園，我們在門口排隊買票。
Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

S.FORM: mukunbu’in tupaka sinsi’ tu “maqa han tanangaus aiza ka loqe, maqa han tanhiku’ aiza ka ivut, anaka sadu.
S.TRANSL: so you can visit them yourself.""
After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

S.FORM: mapising cak ivut, pangqa ni cak sadu ivut.
S.TRANSL: 我會怕蛇，所以我不看蛇類。
I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

S.FORM: sadu cak madia loqe’, ihan nai daza’ lukic kusbabai, usadu’an cak toqu ihan kunbu tuszoq lukic masabaq.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了很多鳥，他們在樹上飛來飛去，我看到貓頭鷹在樹洞裡睡覺。
I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

S.FORM: maqa kumbu di ka heza zo, uma’ cin kuknav, niang cak qabas senidu naidi, manaskal cak haip mun’iti sadu.
S.TRANSL: 這裡面有象、馬和老虎，我從前沒有看過這些動物，今天看到了真的很開心。
There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

S.FORM: madia nak ka sinlasasing na pasadu zaku tamatina.
S.TRANSL: 我拍了很多照片，給爸爸媽媽看。
I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

S.FORM: maqe moqnin na taskun cak tamatina nak mun’iti.
S.TRANSL: 下次要跟我的爸爸媽媽一起來。
Next time I will come with my parents.

S.FORM: maqe pal’un haipi, dusa’ cak toqas nak munhan Taitu’ tantungu han pantama’un nam.
S.TRANSL: 這個假日，我和姊姊去台東拜訪我們的叔叔。
This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.

S.FORM: minihan cam Mihavaz tundaza’ kisia’ munhan Taitu’.
S.TRANSL: 我們從水里搭火車去臺東。
We took the train from Shuili to Taitung.

S.FORM: kahanin cam Taitu’, ma’unting nga pantama’un lehleh munhan pandu’anlehleh anpasdu zami.
S.TRANSL: 我們到了台東，叔叔開車來車站接我們。
When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

S.FORM: maqa pandu’anlehleh ka nitu daqvisan ni lumaq pantama’un, mahiv ma’unting lehleh ka ka’ita’in.
S.TRANSL: 車站離叔叔家沒有很遠，開車一下子就到了。
The station is not far from my uncle’s house, and it’s just a short drive away.

S.FORM: heza madaing sepukan sinepuk han ngalan lumaq pantama’un, tincuzinsa’ cam mun’ita.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔家附近有個很大的牧場，我們一起騎腳踏車去那裡。
There is a big ranch near my uncle’s house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

S.FORM: han sepukan sinepuk, dasun cam pantama’un nam paka’un sidi tundaza’ uma’.
S.TRANSL: 在牧場，叔叔帶我們餵羊和騎馬。
In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

S.FORM: sanavan’in, muskun cam munhan maci’ ma’un.
S.TRANSL: 到了晚上，我們一起去市區吃飯。
In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

S.FORM: madia lehleh han maci’, pangqa tundaza’ cam utuvai’ mun’ita’.
S.TRANSL: 市區車子很多，所以我們騎摩托車去那裡。
There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

S.FORM: matu namudanin na, uka a utuvai’ tangqai’iu’un bunun, muazin cam tunbasu’ mudan.
S.TRANSL: 要離開的時候，摩托車不見被人偷了，我們只好搭公車離開。
When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

S.FORM: hanin cam lopaku Nantu’, nitu qanciap tu kinu’ananin opa ka utuvai’ i pantama’un.
S.TRANSL: 現在我們回到南投了，不知道叔叔的摩托車找到了沒有。
Now that we are back in Nantu, I don’t know if my uncle’s motorcycle has been found.

S.FORM: ihan nam tamazu’an na lumaq tu uva’azng, pantu’in na mulusqu’ cam munhan Taiciu’, civung ihan baq miqumic.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我們家住在地利，上學以後，我們就搬到了台中，一直在都市裡生活。
When we were young, our family lived in tamazu’an. After I started school, we moved to Taichung and have been living in the city ever since.

S.FORM: munhanin pantu’daing, masipul cak pali’unin iniqumican takisilazan, tu’ipin cak maqanciap icia takitaivang di vevivevi sidoq tu iniqumican.
S.TRANSL: 上了大學以後，我修了一堂關於原住民文化的課程，瞭解到臺灣原住民族有各式各樣豐富的文化。
After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

S.FORM: pangqa, matu pal’u’un haip qamisan, dusa cak ki masitoqas nak munhan acang macingav madadengaz, na’asa maqanciap anak’anak sidoq tu iniqumican.
S.TRANSL: 因此，今年暑假時，我和哥哥回到部落訪問老人家，想要瞭解自己族群的文化。
So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

S.FORM: mavo’unin qamisan na qudas, qala talmintukang sadu’an.
S.TRANSL: 老人家已經八十歲了，但是看起來還像中年人。
The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

S.FORM: cingavan zami tu ma’aq qa qancepun cia qalinga, malmananu’ naip malasbunun, maqanciap amin malastolu cin malasput hezang malaslepun.
S.TRANSL: 我們問他會哪些語言，他的布農說得很流利，也會說漢語及閩南語和日本話。
I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Bunun, as well as Chinese, Hokkien and Japanese.

S.FORM: cingavan zami naip tudipin cam maqanciap, tikicang naip tu pinanamin malaslepun, matu kukuzakin na madia pasaqalan put cin tolu, pangqa madia cia ka qancepun qalinga.
S.TRANSL: 我們問他才知道，原來他小時候就學過日本話，而他工作上認識許多閩南人和漢人，所以他會說這麼多語言。
I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, and he knows many Hokkien and Chinese at work, so he can speak so many languages.

S.FORM: matu macingav cam ma, madia cia madadengaz za palcicia takiqabas qanup tu snkukuza.
S.TRANSL: 我們訪談的時候，老人家談論了許多關於狩獵的傳統知識。
During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

S.FORM: qaltu ni cam amin itqal, qala kuci’an zami lingva lasasing, namaqtu uqna’un manengkal tan’a.
S.TRANSL: 雖然我們沒有辦法完全聽懂，但是我們有用手機錄影，可以再仔細聆聽。
Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

S.FORM: matu atikicang cam ma nitu saqal anak’anak sidoq tu iniqumican, miliskin anak’anak tu bunun na maz’avdaingaz.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我們不瞭解自己族群的文化，對於自己是原住民有點不好意思。
When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

S.FORM: malassaqalin na, miliskin anak’anak tu bunnun na, tutuza’ tu makisvevi, heza’an kainaskalan.
S.TRANSL: 少為瞭解愈之以後，愈覺得自己身為布農族人，是很獨特的，也很值得高興。
The more I know, the more I feel that being a Bunun is unique and something to be proud of.

S.FORM: namulumaq ti a masinoba’ haip sanavan.
S.TRANSL: 今天傍晚，弟弟就要回家了。
My younger brother is going home this evening.

S.FORM: dusa’ cak ki qudasno’az munhan babalivan mabaliv tulkuk, mahanat macial isqul ispaka’un masinoba’ sanavanin.
S.TRANSL: 我和奶奶去市場買雞，準備煮好吃的晚餐給弟弟。
My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

S.FORM: laqai’ cam balivansanglav madia’ a ma’u’uvul tu sanglav.
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了菜攤，有好多新鮮的青菜。
We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

S.FORM: mabaliv cam ingsai’, tanbungna’ cin tolacdangqac.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了空心菜、山藥和胡蘿蔔。
We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.

S.FORM: tupa ka dinglan babalivan koko’un tu, “madavuc nak ka bunglai’ cin qalup, baliva tikic!”
S.TRANSL: 旁邊水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和桃子很甜。買一些吧!」
The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”

S.FORM: mabaliv cam munglai’ cin qalup.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了鳳梨和桃子。
We bought pineapples and peaches.

S.FORM: laqai’ cam babalivan titi’, tupa ka babalivan tu, “maq su a balivun? madaing haip pa tulkuk ka malac tausaba cui tas’a.”
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼?今天的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」
We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today's chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”

S.FORM: maqlican na qudasno’az, macingav nip babalivan tu, “maqtu opa iasui’ tikic.”
S.TRANSL: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆可不可以便宜一點。
Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

S.FORM: qala tupa ka babalivan tu, “iasui’in ’ni’in maqtu vanaqan.”
S.TRANSL: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。
But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

S.FORM: tupa ka dingalan babalivan tu, “baliva iskan nak, manak ka iskan na madaing nga iasui.”
S.TRANSL: 隔壁的老闆說，來買我的魚，我的魚又大又便宜。
The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

S.FORM: kinuzin mabaliv cam tulkuk mabaliv amin iskan, mulumaq mahanat tas’a pangka isqul.
S.TRANSL: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子的菜餚。
In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.

S.FORM: talmuntun mantatala, misdumdumin na diqanin.
S.TRANSL: 等了好久，天已經黑了。
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

S.FORM: kalingva’ a masinoba tu, “mucqa nitu maqtu pal’u’un, nahanin monin islongqu’an mulumaq.”
S.TRANSL: 弟弟打電話回來說，軍隊突然不能放假了，要下一個禮拜日才回來。
The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn't take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

S.FORM: tupa ka qudasno’az tu, “madia’in na sinhanat, una’ui ka bunun muskun ma’un!”
S.TRANSL: 奶奶說已經煮了這麼多，叫大家一起來吃吧!
Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let's eat together!

S.FORM: una’un zami ka tec’an cin kaviaz, muskun ma’un madia isqul tu sanavan.
S.TRANSL: 我們邀請了親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。
We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

S.FORM: heza nak uskunan tupa’un tu Kimat, qanglac naip minpungul madas qemangsut.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個同學叫Kimat，他常常忘記帶東西。
I have a classmate named Kimat, he often forgets to bring things.

S.FORM: maca isnava’anin na, simul naip han uskunan inpicu’, isqeqesqes mintun patasan tu haqel.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，他跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。
During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

S.FORM: matu miuc’an, mupusan, muti’un, pasimulanng zami naip qemangsut.
S.TRANSL: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。
Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

S.FORM: qala madikla’ nip pi, qanglac simul la nitu macoqes qemangsut.
S.TRANSL: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。
But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

S.FORM: dungzavin amin cam nitu asa pasimul cai qemangsut.
S.TRANSL: 變得大家都不想借他東西了。
In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

S.FORM: heza tu tas’a qani’an muskun cam munata paqaqenan.
S.TRANSL: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。
One day, we all went on an outing together.

S.FORM: matu han dan na, asa ka Kimat munata, qala minpungul naip madas haqel isqesqes.
S.TRANSL: 路途中，Kimat想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。
On the way, Kimat wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

S.FORM: simul naip han uskunan haqel isqesqes, amin cam antalam tupa tu, uka amin nak inadas.
S.TRANSL: 他跟同學借衛生紙，可是大家都回他說，我也沒有帶耶。
He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn’t bring them either.

S.FORM: tangicin na Kimat, mahau’ naip tupa tu “makua amu tuna amin nitu pasimul zaku haqel isqesqes!”
S.TRANSL: Kimat急的哭了出來。他生氣的說，為什麼大家都不借我衛生紙!
Kimat burst into tears. He said angrily, why don’t everyone lend me toilet paper!

S.FORM: tupaun uskunan tu “opa ni asu anak madas, musutu maca pasimul su’u qemangsut, ni asu qanciap macoqes!”
S.TRANSL: 同學告訴他，因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還!
The classmate told him, because you didn’t bring it yourself, and you wouldn’t return the things lent to you!

S.FORM: munkaku’in laqbing, matingmut ta Kimat kahan kaku’, aminun Kimat ta sinimul cia qemangsut macoqes han uskunan.
S.TRANSL: 隔天上學，Kimat很早就到學校了，Kimat把跟同學借的東西都還給同學們。
The next day at school, Kimat arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

S.FORM: masihan na Kimat uskunan masumsum, tupa tu na’anakanakin naip madas qemangsut, miqumican uskunan pasimul cia qabas qemangsut.
S.TRANSL: kimat向同學們道歉，並說他以後一定會自己帶東西，也謝謝同學們之前願意借他東西。
Kimat apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.

S.FORM: qaqanup nak ka tama.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸是獵人。
My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

S.FORM: matu atikicang cak ka, dusa’ nai tama ki pantama’un sanavan munata’, madas nai via’ cin bucul.
S.TRANSL: 我小的時候，爸爸和叔叔會在晚上出門，帶著獵刀和獵槍。
When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.

S.FORM: maqe tusqangin na, mama’ nai pinanaq tesmumut.
S.TRANSL: 天亮時，他們就會背著獵到的獵物回來。
At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

S.FORM: mintun cia vanis, mintun cia haval, duanduan amin heza linas.
S.TRANSL: 有時候是山豬、有時候是飛鼠，偶爾也會有雉雞。
Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

S.FORM: matu soqesin mu’acang nanu pavazunin nai ka bahi’ nai, na’ispaqusil li tec’an.
S.TRANSL: 他們會在進村前早將獵物分好，分享給族人。
They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

S.FORM: qelic cak tupa ki tama tu “namalavi cak qanup.”
S.TRANSL: 我每次都吵著爸爸，我要跟著去打獵。
Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: tupa ka tama tu tudipi taldaingin asu kana adasunin asu.”
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說等你長大了他再帶我一起去。
Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.

S.FORM: maqanciap amin na bananaz han acang mahaqu’ madamu tesmumut, maqanciap amin matas’i haqumucqut cin malqatu’ .
S.TRANSL: 部落的男人也會用陷阱抓獵物，他們也會製作套索陷阱和石壓式陷阱。
The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.

S.FORM: maqanciap pa tama nak matas’i haqubantac, tupa ka tama tu “ishaqu’ epi linas, asa ata tu saqal dapan ni tesmumut, pihanun dan ni tesmumut ta haqu’.”
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很會製作套索陷阱，爸爸說，這是用來捕抓雉雞的，我們要仔細觀察獵物的腳印，陷阱要放在獵物走的路上。

My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.

S.FORM: tis’uni asa mahiav malavi madadengaz qanup, lucbut cak pinanam malhaqu’, nitu talmadia’ tishaqu’an na haqu’ nak tesmumut.
S.TRANSL: 為了可以趕快和大人一起去打獵，我每天練習製作陷阱，很快地我的陷阱就抓到獵物了。
In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

S.FORM: sadu’an tama ka tupaun cak cia tu “namin’uni asu mamangan tu qaqanup.”
S.TRANSL: 爸爸看到後他對我說我以後一定會是很厲害的獵人。
Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.

S.FORM: taldaingin cak lopaku, angqeli’an cak buculkahkah cin kus, malavi ki tama muskun qanup.
S.TRANSL: 現在我長大了，我背起我的弓和箭矢，跟著爸爸一起去打獵。
Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: mucoqesin na unna qenanup tesmumut ispaqusil tec’an.
S.TRANSL: 回村時將獵到的獵物和族人們分享。
When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

S.FORM: tupa ka tama tu “asa ata tu matumacqeng memadadengaz tu sintuqumic, maqtu ata madia’ bahi’.”
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說，我們要感謝祖靈賜福，讓我們有很多獵物收穫。
Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

S.FORM: pitu’ cak tuki’ haip kahan kaku’.
S.TRANSL: 我今天七點到學校。
I arrived at school at seven today.

S.FORM: kitnga’in, minsumin na sinsi’, tupa ka lavivi’an tu “mindangkaza! masumsum!”
S.TRANSL: 上課了，老師來了，班長說:「起立!敬禮!」
It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”

S.FORM: pidaingun zami tupa tu “miqumicang sinsi’.”
S.TRANSL: 我們大聲的說:「老師好。」
We said loudly, “Hi, teacher.”

S.FORM: kinga’in isnava’an, isnava’an cam sinsi’ malasbunun masipul sipulun.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，老師教我們數字的族語。
In class, the teacher taught us the Bunun language of numbers.

S.FORM: sisili cam sinsi’ masipul, tusauc cam sipulun tu sintusauc.
S.TRANSL: 我們跟著老師唸，我們唱了數字歌。
We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

S.FORM: uqancepan cak madia malasbunun.
S.TRANSL: 我學會好多族語。
I have learned many Bunun languages.

S.FORM: daqdaqqanin cak munkaku’, daqdaqqanin cak pinanam malasbunun, patan’a zaku tina nak.
S.TRANSL: 我天天去學校，我天天學族語，我要講給媽媽聽。
I go to school every day, I learn the Bunun language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

S.FORM: halacan cak tingmut munhan kaku’.
S.TRANSL: 我早上上學遲到了。
I was late for school this morning.

S.FORM: minpungul cak madas kavang, munhan kaku’.
S.TRANSL: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。
When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.

S.FORM: uka’ nak inadas mazmaz.
S.TRANSL: 我什麼東西都沒有帶。
I didn't bring anything with me.

S.FORM: muskun cak uskunan sadu, hung tu isnava’an.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。
During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

S.FORM: matu siking nga, simul cak han uskunan inpicu’ cin isqeqesqes.
S.TRANSL: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。
During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

S.FORM: tupa’un cak sinsi’ tu, “matingmut minoqu, ka’in tu moqnang halacan!”
S.TRANSL: 老師跟我說：「下次早點起床，不要再遲到了!」
The teacher told me, Wake up earlier next time and don't be late again!""

S.FORM: Tiang nga kaviaz nak, uva’az amin aipa Bunun.
S.TRANSL: 我的好朋友叫Tiang，他也布農族的小孩。
My good friend’s name is Tiang, and he is also an Bunun child.

S.FORM: muskun cam ihan Malavi’ tu acang masipul.
S.TRANSL: 我們一起在潭南部落讀書。
We study together in the Malavi’ tribe.

S.FORM: lucbut cam muskun tan’a madadengaz taqu paliqabasan, amin cam maqanciap malasBunun.
S.TRANSL: 我們常常一起聽耆老說故事，我們都很會說布農語。
We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Bunun proficiently.

S.FORM: madaqvas cak ka masboq, maqa Tiang nga maputis sa makuis.
S.TRANSL: 我很高也很胖，Tiang很矮也很瘦。
I am tall and overweight, while Tiang is short and thin.

S.FORM: makackac ca Tiang nga, amin cam asa cia.
S.TRANSL: Taing很有活力，大家都很喜歡他。
Tiang is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

S.FORM: pintataiv haip pa kaku’, madia’ ’a unpintatauv.
S.TRANSL: 今天是學校的運動會，學校舉辦了許多競賽。
Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

S.FORM: heza’ pasibutbut, katundaq mali’, tindangkul, uluzi’, manaq buculkahkah.
S.TRANSL: 有拔河、足球、跑步、跳舞和射箭。
There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.

S.FORM: minhamu cak patindangkul.
S.TRANSL: 我比賽跑步。
I participated in the running competition.

S.FORM: matu tindangkul cak ka, mutingkul la, qedangun na qa’.
S.TRANSL: 當我跑步的時候，我跌倒了，膝蓋流血了。
When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

S.FORM: qala mindangkaz cak, moqnang tindangkul.
S.TRANSL: 但我站起來，繼續向前跑。
But I stood up and continued running forward.

S.FORM: matu ka’ita’in cak ka amin na bunun manaskal.
S.TRANSL: 我到終點時所有人都很開心。
Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

S.FORM: qal tu ni tu lavai’ ’a, manaskal cak, opa sokanaqtung cak pintataiv.
S.TRANSL: 雖然沒有獲得第一名，但我很高興，因為我完成了比賽。
Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.

S.FORM: dusa’ cak tama takna tantungu han tamaSai’.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我和爸爸去拜訪我的Sai叔叔。
Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

S.FORM: milu’lu’ cai tamaSai’ ’a bantac.
S.TRANSL: Sai'叔叔的腳受傷了。
My uncle injured his foot.

S.FORM: taqu’an cam cia tu, “mutuszoq qa tatavi ka.”
S.TRANSL: 他告訴我們，房子的屋頂破了一個洞。
He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.

S.FORM: matu matas’i naip tatavi ka, minihan daza’ tatavi muqalqal.
S.TRANSL: 他在修理屋頂時，從屋頂摔下來了。
He fell off the roof while repairing it.

S.FORM: madas sa tama ki titi’qanvang cin pinung ispaska’ ’i tamaSai’.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸帶了牛肉和檳榔給Sai'叔叔。
My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

S.FORM: dusa’ cak ki tamaSai’ ihan palan pababazbaz, madia’ cia ka sintaqu paliqabasan.
S.TRANSL: 我和叔叔在房間裡聊天，他分享了很多故事。
My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

S.FORM: matu namudanin cak ka, tupa ka tamaSai’ tu taldaqvasin cak ka mintalmindukin."
S.TRANSL: 我要離開前，Sai叔叔誇我長高了，也變得更帥氣了。
Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

S.FORM: tupa cak tu, “maca mincialin na bantac ci tamaSai’ ’a, tantungu han lumaq nam.”
S.TRANSL: come to our house next time and visit us.""
I said, When your foot gets better

S.FORM: ihan 2022 qamisan, palaqanciap pa Sehu’ tu maqa takisilaza tu niuvunsiu’ ’a maqtu kopa’un nganBunun mapatas.
S.TRANSL: 在2022年，政府召開了原住民身分證可單列族名的會議。
In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

S.FORM: macingav cak ki malbuntu tupa ki Sehu’ tu, “kopa’un nganBunun mapatas” han niuvunsiu’, talmindu tu Tiang tasikavan.
S.TRANSL: 我訪問了長期向政府爭取身分證「單列族名」的部落青年Tiang tasikavan。
I interviewed Tiang tasikavan, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

S.FORM: patupakin cak cia tu namaca pal’u’un namunhan cak lumaq cia macingav.
S.TRANSL: 我和他約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。
We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.

S.FORM: matu ihan pacingav va, taqu’an cak cia tu mini’icaqa ngan cia, adasun cak cia pasaqal li tastulumaq cia cin acang cia.
S.TRANSL: 在訪問的過程中，他向我介紹了他的名字的由來，也帶我認識了他的家人、他的部落。
During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

S.FORM: cingavan zaku naip tu makua cuna asa’un na ngan mahuvaiv, niqa macial la sinpatas qabas?
S.TRANSL: 我問他為什麼堅持要改名，舊的登記方式不好嗎?
I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?

S.FORM: tupa naip zaku tu, “opa maqa malastolu ka ni tu maqtu tupa ki anakanak tu ngan tulivaun ni bunun luklac tu Ti sinsi’ isqaqenanin aipi.
S.TRANSL: \" which resulted in many jokes being made."
He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \Di Xian Sheng

S.FORM: tupa ka Tiang tasikavan tu, “maqa mamantu tu ngan na cia kuci’an malasBunun mapatas, maqa ngan na pasqal li sidoq cin tastulumaq, maqtu’ang nga Bunun mucoqes kilim mi ngan mapatas.”
S.TRANSL: our family
Tiang tasikavan said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group

S.FORM: malavi cak takna qudasno’az muhan unapukan babalivan, madas sa qudasno’az madia’ sincuaz cia sanglav, matas’i amin itucia Bunun tu kokonun iscav bunun.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我跟奶奶去市集擺攤，奶奶帶了許多自己種的蔬菜去，也製作了原住民美食給大家。
Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

S.FORM: amin na bunun asa ki babalivan ni qudasno’az, madia’ bunun mabaliv daqput cin daqputpa’ic, madia’ bunun minsuma tanam ma’un sinhanat cia sanglav.
S.TRANSL: 大家很喜歡奶奶的攤位，辣椒和車輪茄很多人買，許多人來品嘗她煮的菜餚。
Everyone loved my grandmother’s stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

S.FORM: macial konun na sinhanat cia li’li’ cin qesing dulaz, hezang vanis hibulan maqav sinhanat tu titi’, madia’ bunun hancuman, masan tidelaz han babalivan nam.
S.TRANSL: 她煮的蕨菜和糯米飯非常好吃，還有用山豬肉煮的馬告滷肉，味道吸引了很多客人，大家都來我們攤位排隊。
The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

S.FORM: mahanat ta qudasno’az zi kokonun na, ihan cak ngalan luluklac ci bunun, pidengun zaku luklac tu, “anak’anak ka sanglav sincuaz, ni tu cinulan iu’ tel’anak tal’ia tu sanglav, kava muhan di mabaliv!”
S.TRANSL: all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!\""
While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown

S.FORM: mahiav nam ma isbabaliv aminun mabaliv, tupa ka qudasno’az tu, “opa heza’ asu kadangaz za.”
S.TRANSL: 我們的東西很快就賣完了，奶奶說：「都是因為有你的幫忙。」
Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, \It’s all thanks to your help.\""

S.FORM: minihan sinkukuza di, uqancepan cak itucia bunun ismut cin kokonun tu qanciap, musu tu uqancepan ni icia babalivan tu ineqdi’an.
S.TRANSL: 這個活動，我學到了有關原住民植物和食品的知識，並且體驗到了擺攤的辛苦。
Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.

S.FORM: sadu ki qudasno’an malkacia itubunun kokonun tu qanciap, mastan cak matumaceqeng unaskalan.
S.TRANSL: 看到了奶奶對傳統食物的熱愛，我感到非常尊敬和榮幸。
Seeing my grandmother’s passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.
